subject: Accidents and Safety
Automobiles
Indianapolis 500 (Auto Race)
lead_paragraph: The IndyCar driver Vitor Meira could be out four months after breaking two vertebrae in his back during the Indianapolis 500. A. J. Foyt’s team hired the former Champ Car points champion Paul Tracy to drive in Milwaukee in place of Meira, who was injured Sunday when he and the rookie Raphael Matos locked wheels late in the race. Meira’s car spun toward the wall and flipped on its side. The car slid down the track with two tires on the ground and two above the concrete wall, then flipped over, with all four wheels on the ground, before rolling to a stop.
